metadata.title: CVE-2022-2122 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
DOS / potential heap overwrite in qtdemux using zlib decompression. Integeroverflow in qtdemux element in qtdemux_inflate function which causes asegfault, or could cause a heap overwrite, depending on libc and OS.Depending on the libc used, and the underlying OS capabilities, it could bejust a segfault or a heap overwrite.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2122` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gstreamer1.0-gtk3 - 1.20.3-0ubuntu1
gstreamer1.0-plugins-good - 1.20.3-0ubuntu1
gstreamer1.0-pulseaudio - 1.20.3-0ubuntu1
gstreamer1.0-qt5 - 1.20.3-0ubuntu1
libgstreamer-plugins-good1.0-0 - 1.20.3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gst-plugins-good1.0 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.20.3-0ubuntu1').
openjfx package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
